I.</br>Sonorous DAUGHTER of the BOX!</br>On this high Poplar hang, my LYRE,</br>While Heaven thus smiles, and Vernal Airs</br>Play, wanton, with the Leaves.
II.</br>Thy trembling Strings a whispering Breeze</br>Soft shall attune; while I, beneath,</br>On this green Bank supinely lie,</br>Thus carelessly diffus'd!
III.</br>The rilling Brook, that murmurs by,</br>Shall lull my Thoughts, till gentle Sleep</br>Seize Me; with pleasing Golden Dreams</br>Of my CECILIA blest!
IV.</br>But ah! — What sudden Clouds Above</br>Fly shadowing!  How dark the Air!</br>What Sound of clattering Hail I hear?</br>Rise, luckless DAMON, Rise.
How soon, alas!  thy Joys decay!</br>How swift all Pleasures haste away!</br>
